Once again, the rarity of true blue pigmentation in animals is preserved. Although some if these fish are blue, the color appears to originate from biliverdin, a result of dietary consumption (think pink flamingos).

Only two vertebrates and one insect appear to actually produce true blue cellular pigment: the obrina olivewing butterfly and two species of mandarin fish.
